summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 10, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) personnel and others, discussing the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt and subsequent death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It reveals frantic communication, concerns about hoax calls to Epstein's associates, and coordination issues between the Bureau of Prisons (BOP), FBI, and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased federal inmate at the center of the communications; his reported suicide attempt and death at MCC are the subject of the emails.

events.title: Epstein's Reported Suicide Attempt and Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is reported to have been taken by ambulance to the hospital from the MCC following another apparent suicide attempt. Later updates confirm he has passed away.

events.title: Hoax Call Regarding Epstein's Body
events.description: Defense counsel reports that an associate of Epstein received a call from an individual claiming to be an MCC investigator, stating Epstein's body was ready for pickup, raising concerns about hoaxes.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The emails capture the chaotic hours following Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt and death on August 10, 2019.
There was significant frustration from the U.S. Attorney's Office about receiving information from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) slower than the press.
Defense counsel reported receiving potentially hoax calls, including one where a caller impersonated an MCC investigator to tell an Epstein associate the body was ready for pickup.
Coordination issues are highlighted, with requests for the FBI and DOJ-OIG to be points of contact for the death investigation and to prevent BOP from releasing the body prematurely.
The document shows internal government communication struggling to manage information flow and verify facts in the immediate aftermath of a high-profile inmate's death.
